Package org.cesecore.authorization

Interface AuthorizationSession

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AuthorizationSessionLocal, AuthorizationSessionRemote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AuthorizationSessionBean
    public interface AuthorizationSession
    Main interface for checking authorization. This interface makes use of roles and entity authentication to verify authorization.
    Version:
    $Id: AuthorizationSession.java 25135 2017-01-27 15:27:27Z jeklund $

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void forceCacheExpire()
      Helper method to clear the local access control rule cache.
      boolean isAuthorized​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken, String... resources)
      Checks if the current user is authorized for the given resource.
      boolean isAuthorizedNoLogging​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken, String... resources)
      Checks if the current user is authorized for the given resource.

    • Method Detail

      • isAuthorized

        boolean isAuthorized​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                     String... resources)
        Checks if the current user is authorized for the given resource. Will create audit log.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - The AuthenticationToken to check access for.
        resources - String identifier(s) of the resource(s) in question.
        Returns:
        true if user is authorized, false if not.

      • isAuthorizedNoLogging

        boolean isAuthorizedNoLogging​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                              String... resources)
        Checks if the current user is authorized for the given resource. Will not create any audit log.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - The AuthenticationToken to check access for.
        resources - String identifier(s) of the resource(s) in question.
        Returns:
        true if user is authorized, false if not.

      • forceCacheExpire

        void forceCacheExpire()
        Helper method to clear the local access control rule cache. Normally the cache expires after configured time, but when modifying access rules on the local node we can force cache clearing so we don't have to wait. Other nodes in a cluster will still wait until expire though.
